      • map

        public void map(Mapper mapper,
                Object source,
                Object destination)
         throws MappingException
        Description copied from interface: MapConvention
        Executes mappings. Implementation should handle two scenarios:
        1. when for particular instance MapConvention.build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) is not executed before first execution of this method
        2. when for particular instance MapConvention.build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) is executed before first execution of this method (but never concurrently or after first call on this method)

        Implementation must be thread-safe in both of those scenarios. Implementation cannot produce state that is shared state between calls, but may use data produced by MapConvention.build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) method. Acquiring locks is not permitted.

        If mapping is not supported MappingException will be thrown.

        Specified by:
        map in interface MapConvention
        Parameters:
        mapper - mapper delegating mapping to this convention.
        source - source object.
        destination - destination object.
        Throws:
        MappingException
        See Also:
        Map.useConvention(org.beancp.MapConvention), MapperBuilder.addMapAnyByConvention(org.beancp.MapConvention...)

      • tryMap

        public boolean tryMap(Mapper mapper,
                      Object source,
                      Object destination)
               throws MappingException
        Description copied from interface: MapConvention
        Executes mappings. Implementation should handle two scenarios:
        1. when for particular instance MapConvention.build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) is not executed before first execution of this method
        2. when for particular instance MapConvention.build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) is executed before first execution of this method (but never concurrently or after first call on this method)

        Implementation must be thread-safe in both of those scenarios. Implementation cannot produce state that is shared state between calls, but may use data produced by MapConvention.build(org.beancp.MappingInfo, java.lang.Class, java.lang.Class) method. Acquiring locks is not permitted.

        If mapping is supported for passed object types will return false{code}, otherwise return true{code}.

        Specified by:
        tryMap in interface MapConvention
        Parameters:
        mapper - mapper delegating mapping to this convention.
        source - source object.
        destination - destination object.
        Returns:
        true{code} if mapping is supported for passed object types, otherwise true{code}.
        Throws:
        MappingException
        See Also:
        Map.useConvention(org.beancp.MapConvention), MapperBuilder.addMapAnyByConvention(org.beancp.MapConvention...)
